message_1: What happens when zinc metal is added to a solution of copper sulfate? Write the balanced chemical equation for the reaction and identify the type of single replacement reaction that has occurred.
message_2:
When zinc metal is added to a solution of copper sulfate, a single replacement reaction occurs. In this reaction, zinc displaces copper from copper sulfate, forming zinc sulfate and copper metal. The balanced chemical equation for the reaction is:

Zn (s) + CuSO4 (aq) â†’ ZnSO4 (aq) + Cu (s)

This is a single replacement (also known as single displacement) reaction, where one element (zinc) replaces another element (copper) in a compound.
